name: places/ChIJYbJDoZ32wokRs9EBWbJcRVM
formattedAddress: 514 W 168th St, New York, NY 10032, USA
adrFormatAddress: 514 W 168th St, New York, NY 10032, USA

editorialSummary.text: Contemporary hotel offering bright, modern rooms, some with city views, plus Wi-Fi & a gym.

originalText.text: Had a 2 night stay while having a procedure done at Columbia hospital.  The hospital is pretty close by and this is really the only hotel option that i could find within walking distance.  The hotel is neat and clean.  Rooms are small, but the bathroom is a decent size relative to the size of the rooms.   Service was great and friendly and Dominick was a great help orienting us to the neighborhood.  The area has a pretty eclectic selection of restaurants.  My main complaint was noise - some of which the hotel can't control.  My room directly faced 168th street and you could hear emergency vehicles with their sirens blaring throughout the night.  The walls are pretty thin so depending on your neighbors, they can wake you several times during the night.  There is also an issue with elevator noise - every time it moves, there is a banging noise that is clearly heard in the rooms throughout the night.  They need to have that looked at and get it fixed.  Other reviews have mentioned this, so this is not a new issue.  Lastly, eating in the room with more than one person is pretty much a non-starter - there just isn't enough room for 2.

originalText.text:
Very friendly staff.
We only needed the room to sleep, as we were in the area for our grandsons surgery.
Room was compact, but clean. Bed was comfortable.
Big issue was the heavy metal doors to the room. Anytime someone entered, or left their room, the door would slam very loudly throughtout the whole floor. Also, walls aren't well insulated and could hear if someone opened, or closed their closets in the next room.
It's a nice enough hotel overall.

originalText.text: This was my very, first visit to NYC and this was the perfect hotel for me to be It, was SUPER clean!! My son had an event at the Nike Amory and I walked to the place from my hotel and felt safe. The highlight was the hotel staff, Luis Gomez!!! I had an incident with a taxi that was called to pick me up for the airport and, it was a very bad experience with the cab driver he was going to put me out in the middle of nowhere because I did not have CASH!!! I had to beg him with tears in my eyes to take me back to the hotel remember I was not from NYC and the hotel called the cab for me and I just assumed he took cards. Once I got back. Luis was very upset with the cab company and sprung into action to make sure that I did not miss my flight back home! Luis went above and beyond to make sure that I arrived home safe and even had someone to call me when I arrived back in Georgia! I would stay here again!!!

originalText.text:
My room was spacious for NYC, well appointed, and designed to make the most of the space. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. I was in a room that faced south so I got to enjoy a beautiful view of Manhattan from my window.

The staff were very friendly and helpful, I felt accommodated the entire time I was there.

The business center is a nice perk as well

I recommend this hotel! Very nice experience all around.

originalText.text: The hotel was very clean. I loved how tidy and clean the entire hotel was.  The staff were friendly and always helpful! I would highly recommend. If you are having a procedure at NY presbyterian they will give you a discount. There is not parking at the hotel, but there is a parking lot a couple blocks away. You can pull up right in front of the hotel where they have it coned off for guest check in. Check in and then drive to parking. It's a quick walk back. The neighborhood is clean and busy going about their daily business. Nothing like the busy masses in times square. Ask the front desk for a list of restaurants and those that do delivery.  If you are looking for bagels Mike's is awesome!!!
